sentences.english: The police report described, in horrifying detail, the nightmare that followed.
sentences.chinese: 警方卷宗描述了接下来发生的噩梦，令人战栗的细节。

sentences.english: In deep night, when on the narrow bridge the traveler trembles.
sentences.chinese: 每当深夜，浪游者在山间小路哆嗦战栗。

sentences.english: Hence the terrified wrinkle of those brows; hence all those great souls surrendering their swords.
sentences.chinese: 因此万众俯首战栗，因此心灵伟大的人也全交剑投降。

sentences.english: And, trembling like a steed before the start.
sentences.chinese: 象出发前的骏马，总有些战栗。
我喜欢那种战栗的感觉。

sentences.english: I shuddered at the thought of all the trouble I'd caused.
sentences.chinese: 一想到自己惹下的麻烦，我就战栗不已。

sentences.english: As for me, when I remember, I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.
sentences.chinese: 甚至我一回想，我就恐怖，全身战栗。

sentences.english: The pillars of heaven tremble, and dread at his beck.
sentences.chinese: 支天的柱子震动，因他的呵叱而战栗。

sentences.english: She remembered how he had touched her, and trembled at the thought.
sentences.chinese: 她记得他是如何抚摸她的，一想起这些她就浑身战栗。

sentences.english: When he said this to me, I stood up trembling.
sentences.chinese: 他对我说这话时，我站立起来，浑身战栗。

sentences.english: At the mention of Aileen, Berenice experienced a mental chill.
sentences.chinese: 在提到爱玲时，白丽莱茜感到内心的战栗。

sentences.english: Let all the earth be moved at his presence : for he hath founded the world immoveable .
sentences.chinese: 大地在他面前应该战栗，是他使世界坚立，不致动摇。

sentences.english: He quarreled; his voice tremjewelry with fury.
sentences.chinese: 他争论着，他的声响由于朝气而战栗。

sentences.english: Everytime you kissed me, I trembled like a child.
sentences.chinese: 每一次你的亲吻，都让我战栗的像个孩子一样。

sentences.english: In one cruet moment our exhilaration turned to horror;
sentences.chinese: 在那个不幸的时刻，我们的兴奋变成了战栗。

definition: variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
shaking in fear/one's heart palpitating with fear
